conclusion: Determine how shadows A, B, C, and D will change with light source movement.
Shadow A is cast to the left and slightly forward of the object.
Shadow B is cast to the right and slightly forward of the object.
Shadow C is cast to the left and slightly backward of the object.
Shadow D is cast to the right and slightly backward of the object.
Light source is coming from the top left.
Light source moves to the front right, affecting shadow position and size.
Shadow A will shift to the right and slightly forward; size will decrease.
Shadow B will shift to the left and slightly forward; size will decrease.
Shadow C will shift to the right and slightly backward; size will decrease.
Shadow D will shift to the left and slightly backward; size will decrease.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the right and left respectively, and their sizes will decrease.
